intro: Syzygium caryophyllaeum, commonly known as the clove nut or caryophylla, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the island of Timor and is characterized by its small, aromatic fruits that resemble cloves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent. The fruit contains a single seed and is used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some local cuisines.
